lead_paragraph: A gallery at the National September 11 Memorial Museum has photos of all but 10 of the 2,983 people killed in either the 2001 terrorist attacks or the 1993 World Trade Center bombing.

byline.original: By DAVID W. DUNLAP and SUSAN C. BEACHY

headline.print_headline: Seeking the Final Faces  to Fill a Sept. 11 Tapestry
headline.main: Seeking the Final Faces for a 9/11 Tapestry of Grief, Loss, Life and Joy

snippet: A gallery at the National September 11 Memorial Museum has photos of all but 10 of the 2,983 people killed in either the 2001 terrorist attacks or the 1993 World Trade Center bombing....
abstract: National September 11 Memorial Museum has been unable to obtain photographs of 10 out of 2,983 people killed during terrorist attack, leaving handful of blank spaces in its portrait gallery; families of three victims have opted not to display their loved ones' portraits, while remaining seven have defied search.
